Torrential rains in Indonesia destroy villages and leave more than 600 dead
subhead: More than 600 people have died after Tropical Storm Senyar combined with the seasonal monsoon to unleash torrential rains on the island of Sumatra, causing rivers loaded with vegetation to surge down from the highlands.

title: Luigi Mangione, accused of killing a health insurance executive in New York in 2024, leaves Americans divided
subhead: The alleged killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, who was shot dead in broad daylight in Manhattan a year ago, appeared in court for a preliminary hearing on Monday, December 1. He faces life in prison.

title: Raphaël Varane: 'Showing vulnerability does not mean you're weak'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the retired footballer shares his experiences with mental health issues during his career and calls on his sport to break the silence around these problems, which affect an estimated 20% to 35% of professional players.

title: Marseille grapples with drug trafficking: 'They are so many and they have so much money'
subhead: After the murder of Mehdi Kessaci, the brother of an activist against drug trafficking, Le Monde spoke with residents of housing projects, social workers, judges and police officers. They described a growing sense of powerlessness and danger.

Jodie Foster: 'Without cinema, I would have been rigid, dry and much more solitary'
subhead: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a figure about a decisive moment in their life. The American actress pays tribute to her mother, with whom she shared a close, almost inseparable bond for many years.

title: The art of being Oscar Wilde's grandson
subhead: As Ireland prepares to mark the 125th anniversary of Oscar Wilde's death, Merlin Holland, his only living descendant, works in France to protect the memory of a man who was long viewed as scandalous.

title: Mexico's new Frida Kahlo museum bends the truth
subhead: Since opening to the public this fall in Mexico City, a new museum devoted to painter Frida Kahlo has sparked a series of controversies. Contrary to claims by its owners, the house was never the home of the Kahlo family, and a mural discovered on site was likely not the artist's creation.
